An overarching ethical concern was that clinical research should not impact on the health system or the emergency response. The World Health Organization coordinated prioritisation of the most promising research, so as not to overburden the health systems in the affected countries.
15 In Sierra Leone, planning for the EBOVAC-Salone study was undertaken in partnership with the College of Medicine and Allied Health Sciences, and a criterion was set that healthcare workers involved in the emergency response would not be recruited to the study team. Senior staff were therefore recruited from overseas to provide technical support, while also building the experience of more junior national staff who had not previously been involved in clinical research.
